definitions.definition: To add weight to something; to make something heavier.
To load, burden or oppress someone.
To assign weights to individual statistics.
To handicap a horse with a specified weight.
To give a certain amount of force to a throw, kick, hit, etc.

definitions.example: She wore a weighted dress so it wouldn't blow in the wind.

definitions.definition: Biased, so as to favour one party.
definitions.example: The competition was weighted so he'd be the clear favourite to win.

definitions.definition: (of a graph) having values assigned to its edges
With the components of an average multiplied by particular factors so as to take account of their relative importance.
